title: Epic: Multi-domain signup — support gainforest.id alongside climateai.org
description: Allow users to choose between gainforest.id and climateai.org (formerly) when signing up and signing in. These are two separate PDS instances (did:web:climateai.org and did:web:gainforest.id) both requiring invite codes. The SDK already supports both domains as SupportedPDSDomain. The platform needs UI domain selector, per-domain PDS routing for account creation and invite codes, and elimination of hardcoded climateai.org references.

title: Add helper to resolve PDS service URL from domain

description:
## Files
- components/global/modals/sign-up.tsx (modify)

## What to do

Add a domain selector to the sign-up form so users can choose between `climateai.org` and `gainforest.id`.

### Implementation details:

1. Import `allowedPDSDomains` (already imported) and use it to populate a dropdown/select.

2. Add a new state variable:
```typescript
const [selectedDomain, setSelectedDomain] = useState<string>(allowedPDSDomains[0]);
```

3. Replace the hardcoded `.climateai.org` suffix in the handle input (line 159-161) with a `<select>` element styled inline with the input:
```tsx
<InputGroupAddon align="inline-end" className="text-primary">
  <select
    value={selectedDomain}
    onChange={(e) => setSelectedDomain(e.target.value)}
    disabled={isSigningUp}
    className="bg-transparent border-none outline-none text-primary cursor-pointer text-sm"
  >
    {allowedPDSDomains.map((domain) => (
      <option key={domain} value={domain}>.{domain}</option>
    ))}
  </select>
</InputGroupAddon>
```

4. Update the mutation body (line 58) to use `selectedDomain` instead of `allowedPDSDomains[0]`:
```typescript
handle: handle.replace(/^@/, "").trim() + `.${selectedDomain}`,
```

5. Update the post-signup redirect to SignInModal (line 238) to use `selectedDomain`:
```typescript
initialHandle={`${handle}.${selectedDomain}`}
```

title: Add domain selector to sign-in modal and remove hardcoded ClimateAI references
description:
## Files
- components/global/modals/sign-in.tsx (modify)

## What to do

Update the sign-in modal to support both domains via a selector, remove all hardcoded "climateai.org" / "ClimateAI" references, and default to gainforest.id.

### Implementation details:

1. Import `allowedPDSDomains` from `@/config/gainforest-sdk`.

2. Add a new state variable for the selected domain (defaults to first = gainforest.id after qi7.1):
```typescript
const [selectedDomain, setSelectedDomain] = useState<string>(
  allowedPDSDomains[0]
);
```

3. If `initialHandle` is provided (e.g. from sign-up redirect), detect its domain:
```typescript
const initialDomain = allowedPDSDomains.find(d => initialHandle.endsWith(`.${d}`));
// if found, use it as default for selectedDomain
```

4. Replace line 55 (sessionStorage pending handle):
```typescript
// Before: `${inputHandlePrefix}.climateai.org`
// After:
`${inputHandlePrefix}.${selectedDomain}`
```

5. Replace line 87 (modal description):
```typescript
// Before: "Sign in with your ClimateAI account"
// After: "Sign in with your account"
```

6. Replace lines 106-108 (handle input suffix) with a domain selector dropdown:
```tsx
<InputGroupAddon align="inline-end" className="text-primary">
  <select
    value={selectedDomain}
    onChange={(e) => setSelectedDomain(e.target.value)}
    disabled={isRedirecting}
    className="bg-transparent border-none outline-none text-primary cursor-pointer text-sm"
  >
    {allowedPDSDomains.map((domain) => (
      <option key={domain} value={domain}>.{domain}</option>
    ))}
  </select>
</InputGroupAddon>
```

7. Replace line 124 (previous sessions filter) — show sessions from ALL allowed domains, not just one:
```typescript
// Before: if (suffix !== "climateai.org") return null;
// After: if (!allowedPDSDomains.includes(suffix as any)) return null;
```

8. Replace line 175 (redirect text):
```typescript
// Before: "You will be redirected to ClimateAI to authenticate."
// After: "You will be redirected to authenticate."
```

9. Replace line 190 (button text):
```typescript
// Before: "Sign in with ClimateAI"
// After: "Sign in"
```

## Test

grep -c "allowedPDSDomains" components/global/modals/sign-in.tsx  # must be >= 2

bun run build 2>&1 | tail -5

## Do not

- Change the `authorize` server action (separate task)

title: Update authorize server action to accept domain parameter
description:
## Files
- components/actions/oauth.ts (modify)

## What to do

Update the `authorize` server action to accept an optional `domain` parameter so the sign-in modal can pass the selected domain.

### Implementation details:

1. Change the `authorize` function signature:
```typescript
// Before:
export async function authorize(handle: string): Promise<{ authorizationUrl: string }>

// After:
export async function authorize(handle: string, domain?: string): Promise<{ authorizationUrl: string }>
```

2. Update the handle normalization logic (lines 29-31):
```typescript
// Before:
const normalizedHandle = handle.includes(".")
  ? handle
  : `${handle}.${allowedPDSDomains[0]}`;

// After:
const normalizedHandle = handle.includes(".")
  ? handle
  : `${handle}.${domain ?? allowedPDSDomains[0]}`;
```

This is backward compatible — callers that do not pass `domain` get the same behavior as before.

The `getProfile` function (line 157) uses `allowedPDSDomains[0]` for blob URL resolution. This is a separate concern — blob URLs work from either PDS, so leave it as-is for now. It will be addressed in a follow-up data-layer task if needed.

## Test
```bash
# Verify the authorize function accepts 2 params
grep "export async function authorize" components/actions/oauth.ts  # should show (handle: string, domain?: string)
# Build must pass
bun run build 2>&1 | tail -5
```

## Do not
- Change the `getProfile`, `checkSession`, or `logout` functions
- Change any other files
- Remove the fallback to `allowedPDSDomains[0]` — the domain param is optional for backward compat
close_reason: a6617fb Update authorize server action to accept domain parameter

title: Update invite-code route to use NEXT_PUBLIC_ATPROTO_SERVICE_URL and remove hardcoded climateai.org fallback
description:
## Files
- app/api/atproto/invite-code/route.ts (modify)

## What to do

The invite-code route has a hardcoded fallback to `"https://climateai.org"` on line 64. Since invite codes are PDS-specific and this route is admin-only, update it to require the env var or use the config.

### Implementation details:

1. Import `allowedPDSDomains` from `@/config/gainforest-sdk`.

2. Replace line 64:
```typescript
// Before:
const service = process.env.NEXT_PUBLIC_ATPROTO_SERVICE_URL || "https://climateai.org";

// After:
const service = process.env.NEXT_PUBLIC_ATPROTO_SERVICE_URL || `https://${allowedPDSDomains[0]}`;
```

This removes the hardcoded string while keeping the same behavior. The env var override still takes priority.

Note: The invite code route currently creates codes on a single PDS. Supporting multi-PDS invite code generation is a future enhancement — for now, the admin targets whichever PDS is configured via env var.

## Test
```bash
# Verify no hardcoded climateai.org string remains
grep -c "climateai.org" app/api/atproto/invite-code/route.ts  # must be 0
# Verify allowedPDSDomains is imported
grep -c "allowedPDSDomains" app/api/atproto/invite-code/route.ts  # must be >= 1
# Build must pass
bun run build 2>&1 | tail -5
```

## Do not
- Change the invite code creation logic
- Add a domain parameter to the POST body (future enhancement)
- Change database queries
- Modify the admin authentication logic
close_reason: cbb0759 - Remove hardcoded climateai.org fallback, use allowedPDSDomains[0] instead
